description:
I was introduced to this Cafe through Meal Pal and my husband. My favorite part of their sandwiches is the freshly baked bread. They toast it, so it has a perfect crunch to the outside with a soft, chewy inside. I had the Turkey Royal Sandwich, which came with bacon (which I usually don't eat, but did anyway), Swiss cheese, and avocado. Even though these are ingredients that are commonly offered at other sandwich places, I think Good Eats puts their own spin on it and it's worth eating again...and then again. 

I didn't dine in, but they do have some tables. If the line goes out the door, a few tables may feel a bit crowded, but I've noticed this is just how it is at popular lunch spots are in SF.
author: Lori C.

description:
One of the better sandwich places in downtown! (and there's quite a lot of them)

I usually get the Hot Pastrami with caeser salad. It's a decent price, and the salad is a nice addition, even though it's not a large portion it complements the sandwich well.

The sandwich comes with an adequate portion of yummy meat, nicely balanced with lettuce, tomatoes, etc. I like the wheat roll texture that's on the softer side but still has a little bit of crispness to it.
author: Posu Y.

description: I got a pastrami royal sandwich through mealpal for lunch yesterday. It was a bit far from my office but that's of no fault of their own. Super cute hole in the wall restaurant, and when they handed me my sandwich, it was piping hot! It was so delicious, with perfect amounts of pastrami, carmelized onion, bacon, and cheese. I definitely will be coming here again for this sandwich!
author: Katarina L.

description: Solid pastrami sandwiches with freshly made bread (recommend the dutch crunch). Probably one of the better sandwich shops in downtown/FiDi area for a reasonable price. The store doesn't look like much (kind of like a run down subway in a gas station), but the sandwiches always hit the pastrami cravings!
author: Kedar V.

description: I'm in search for the best breakfast burrito in Financial District and have yet to find one. I walked by Good Eats Cafe and decided to try it out. At first, I thought $6 was a steal, but it ended up being smaller than others that I've had in the area. I liked that the tortilla was a little toasted. Other than that, the potatoes were dry, the cheese resembled melted Kraft singles, and it just wasn't really hefty (which is what I typically expect burritos to be). They do have a lot of other sandwiches and salads on their menu that sounded good, so I might try that out for lunch one day.
author: Lillian B.

description: This place has great sandwiches at. Great value.  The owner Ramzy and his wife are so nice and accommodating.  I'd rather go here than Chez Beesen next door, the owner is rude and grumpy and looks evil.
author: James L.

description:
You can't go wrong with Good Eats Cafe. The service is prompt, the food delicious, and the prices most reasonable, especially given its location in the Financial District. 

I'm a big fan of the Chipotle Chicken Sandwich, which comes with a generous portion of avocado and perfectly melted cheese. Dutch Crunch roll is the way to go in my opinion, but all the bread options here are good.

Definitely recommended if you're looking for a new lunch place downtown.
author: Matthew V.

description:
I like their creamy Caesar salad. I got it with the chipotle turkey club sandwich.  Good portion of turkey on their homemade French rolls. 

It gets a 3 star cuz of service. The owner/chef, whoever he was, asked me what I wanted and just ran away to the kitchen. I stood there awkwardly waiting to be rung up. Two gentlemen approached right behind me in line when one of the workers from the back showed up and started taking their orders. That was kinda rude.  At least acknowledge that there's someone there. The people behind me asked this person "aren't you gonna help the lady before us?" And she ever so gladly said "no what would you like".  Hmm, not sure if I'll come back here...
author: Me V.

description: My favorite lunch spot in the Financial District! Without a doubt, I always order the tuna melt with a side Cesar salad. They give you a large portion and it's definitely filling! They have an array of options on their menu for breakfast and lunch. Can't beat the awesome customer service as well! FYI they close at 3pm.
author: Sahar N.

description: the photos of the sammies lured my hunger in again and today, I had a much better experience.  Perhaps I came on an off day previously.  I had a turkey royale on pumpernickel.  The lady behind the counter told me they bake their own bread daily and you could tell.  It was soft, yet crunchy and the seeding was very tasty.   It comes with a choice of salad on the side.  It was so big, I had to split it so it didn't go to waste.
author: Suzy Q.

description:
Do you know that feeling when you think to yourself "should I check my pick up order before I walk out the door"?  Well you know what happens next... you open up the wrapped sandwich and you say out loud "crap!"  

Sandwich bread is soggy, forgot the fillings, and ultimately tastes like .... well, crap.  Sandwich ended up in the garbage.  

Rounding up from 1.5 stars
author: Jan S.

description:
I ordered the chicken chipotle sandwich through mealpal so I didn't really get to choose the type of bread I wanted, but it was still pretty good for the price I am paying through mealpal. I believe it also comes with a side salad if you purchase there directly, but not too sure since it was my first time getting something from here. They also make their bread, fresh daily! (Says their sign) So that is pretty cool. I really enjoyed the avocado spread and the cranberries in the sandwich, it gave it a unique and nice touch to the chipotle chicken sandwich. A bit of spicy-ness, a bit of sweet/tangy-ness and avocado to make me feel a bit of the healthy-ness,  together in one sandwich made it very enjoyable :) I also liked how the chicken was very tender and not super dry like some chicken sandwiches can be. 

The sandwich, however was not super amazing where I would go back because I crave it, but it was still pretty good where I'd get it again. I would also like to try more items on the menu and order directly there instead of meal pal next time so that I can personalize the order to my liking and be able to choose the type of bread next time.
author: Bailey L.

description:
Delicious vegan Falafel Wrap! Moist falafel in a warm and toasty wrap with all the yummy veggies and tahini. I need to grab lunch here more often!

Would love for the restaurant to offer more vegan options and to label the vegan options on the menu! 5 stars regardless because the service is always spectacular.
author: Katie B.

description: This is the best sandwich place in SF! I'd recommend it to anyone in the area. I usually get the pastrami sandwich. The lines can get a little backed up as they only make one sandwich at a time, but it is definitely worth the wait.
author: Wyatt S.

description:
This place have  the best sandwiches in the neighborhood, and the people its so nice 

You have to try once
author: Karla V.

description:
$9.10 including tax for a huge hot turkey sandwich w/avocado + side salad? That's a steal in Fidi - healthy, fresh, cheap.

They make their rolls daily here - dutch crunch, wheat, pumpernickle or french. Pumpernickle was tasty/chewy, though I wasn't a huge fan of the seeds/grains that were sprinkled on it. 

Love that this mom and pop joint is using fresh ingredients here. Their chicken breast looks amazing - will have to come back to try their chicken teriyaki. 

Tips:
- accepts credit card
- rotating daily specials for $7.99
- menu on the side wall and at counter for descriptions of sandwiches
author: Kristie C.

description: Visited while staying at the Loews Hotel on the same street- wanted something fast and more affordable than hotel food. No one was in the store so we ordered and got our food fast. Large servings of decent food. The coffee was horrible. There also seems to be an issue with homeless men right outside the store getting into fights with each other/store owners, which occurred while we were there, and made for an unpleasant and rushed experience.
author: Erin B.

description:
Best sandwiches and great people! Love coming here for lunch, especially when I'm short on time. 
*pastrami sandwich pictured
author: Natalie D.

description:
This place may be Named Good Eats but the sandwiches are opposite of Good.  These sandwiches were the dryest sandwiches I've had in the Financial district.  I had the pastrami and the wife had a tuna salad sandwich.  They provide no flavor or sauces on the sandwich. Go to Lou's, Gambino's, Miss Tomatoes or even Subway if you're looking for any flavor.   No additional condiments are provided either and the service is iffy at best.  

Never saw a deli that didn't use condiments on sandwiches.
author: Daniel W.

description: My office likes the sandwiches from this place. I had their Chipotle Chicken Sandwich and when I first got it, I was skeptical because it had smashed avocado and cranberries. I didn't think they would go well together but I am happy to say I was wrong and they added to the spice of the chicken. The chicken was juicy too! The bread kind of looks like dutch crunch and they grill it though not with oil or butter. I loved the sandwich! It was chewy bread on the outside and juicy chicken inside and the flavors were delicious. I don't often get sandwiches and have to say this Chipotle Chicken Sandwich ranks as a fave.
author: Jen L.

description: 2.50 because they don't have butter for bagels and the cashier was rude about it also as if I SHOULD have known??? Considering all the options in this area, I will definitely skip the place next time I'm in town. #smh
author: Mo P.

description:
Hello new sandwich/cafe lunch spot in FiDi! I'm always looking for a new place to grub, especially when trying to eat healthy-ish (Mixt Greens, The Plant) all great but can get repetitive. Thanks to MealPass (the ClassPass for lunch in SF) this was a new place added as of last week and decided to reserve the "Chicken Pesto Sandwich & Salad." It's right on Pine St. in the midst of FiDi, so accessible by many. The cafe itself is super cute, family owned vibe. Very warm service and they immediately baked the sandwich that I had reserved. 

I have to say it was AWESOME and not overwhelming in a I can't walk now vibe, but super filling and delicious, with a hint of healthy still there. The bread was fresh baked and the melt of the cheese and pesto was so so yummy. My friend even tried and loved it. They provided a green salad and some cookies, which was a nice touch. Outside of MealPass, I believe that they charge around $9 for such a meal, which is REALLY good in the area. Especially for the quality of the food, it was fresh and amazing.

I will be recommending to coworkers/friends and coming back soon. Thank you!
author: Mahsa T.

description: I tried this place for the 1st time today. They only make the sandwiches on the menu and nothing else but, a lot of good choices. Comes with a side salad, sorry but, plain romaine with a splash of Cesar dressing doesn't count as a Cesar salad! I got the chicken pesto. Pretty good. Not as good as the one I get from working girls but, decent. I did find the service a little odd, no greeting, no napkins, sparse drink choices. I will probably give it another try though, near my office and I'm a sandwich girl!
author: Teresa B.

description: I was wondering around FIDI at lunch time looking for something to eat when I saw this place. I came in and the line was pretty short, so I decided to get something. Their menu is long which makes it hard for a first timer to pick anything. I decided to ask a woman at the register if she would recommend something. She said: "It depends what you like. Everything is popular". Oh common, I'm asking for maybe go-to must haves! Anyway, I ordered the spicy chicken with eggplant wrap with a side of Caesar salad. Salad was meh, and the panini (wrap) was below 3/5. The chicken in the wrap had a very weird texture, like it was undercooked (rubbery, but not tough), but it didn't look undercooked- so I'm not sure what it was but I took all the chicken out of the sandwich and just ate the bread and the eggplant. Will not be back - don't want to pay $9+ for a weird tasting chicken that they use for all their sandwiches apparently.
author: Aya J.

description:
Tried this spot after peeping yelp and saw they had pumpernickel bread, which I'm a total sucker for. I used to eat this one sandwich they sold at my college in Southern California, and I had recently been nostalgic for it. So when I saw they had that exact same sandwich, only in wrap form, I was SOLD! On top of that, the very nice lady at the register said they could put it on pumpernickel bread instead of the wrap, yes and YES! The cherry on top was the side salad that came with it. Needless to say, I was a very satisfied customer.

If you like sandwiches, you need to try this spot.
author: Claudia W.

description:
Had the Reuben Supreme something something (pastrami, sauerkraut, 1000 Island, cheese, bacon) on Dutch Crunch, Caesar salad on the side. I was very impressed with the sandwich overall, although I was asked by a colleague if the pastrami itself was actually great and I wasn't sure. There's a lot of stuff on there. I didn't think the bacon was great but only noticed in ~1 of the bites.

Lots of sauce on the sandwich and on the salad by default, which I like but others might not.

I got take out, seems like a standard mostly-take-out lunch spot with few seats.
author: J.P. M.

description:
Based on Yelp reviews, I thought I'd try this place.

A few days ago, I had a Breakfast Veggie Wrap for $5.95.  It was just OK, and for me, not worth going back for compared to other similar options I like better.

Today, I had the Chipotle Chicken with Avocado on Dutch Crunch Bread with a side of Caesar Salad for $8.79.  The combination of the flavors of the sandwich was about 2.5 stars.  The chicken was a bit rubbery.  However, I really liked that they bake their bread daily.  The round Dutch Crunch Bread tasted really good; so, I'll up the overall review to 3 stars.  The Caesar "Salad" was just so-so as it was only romaine lettuce leaves with caesar dressing on them.  Unlike what's shown in some of the Yelp pictures, I was not offered the option of having the sandwich pressed panini style.  I guess you have to make a point to ask them.

Because of the flavor of the freshly baked bread, I might come back, and try more sandwich combinations.
author: Roy C.

description:
JUST got done eating my chicken gyro wrap, and while it maybe wasn't traditional chicken gyros, it was delicious! I was in the mood for a wrap and a so glad I tried this place out. The chicken was juicy and fresh, the veggies and sauce in the wrap were great and the side salad was fresh!

I will definitely be back. Can't wait to try other wraps.
author: Lauren G.

description:
It should actually be called 'Great' Eats Cafe. ;) 
The sandwiches are made with rolls that they bake fresh each day and you can really taste the freshness! Each sandwich also comes with a side of salad so I always feel healthy after eating here. I would strongly recommend the Chipotle Chicken sandwich here with a caesar salad. Although the place is a bit far from my office, it's well worth the walk! I'm going to continue coming here as long as I'm in SF! :)
author: Sahil S.

description: This place is OK, they have a few unique sandwich options and you can get a sandwich with a little side salad for about the same price as you can get a lone sandwich elsewhere in the financial district.  I wasn't a huge fan of the bread they used for the sandwich though and the turkey definitely tastes like Kirkland deli turkey. I haven't gone back ever since I went, about a year ago, but that's not to say I wouldn't (Update: this review was accidentally posted for Fayala, next door, but I meant to post it for this spot about 6 months ago).
author: Emma H.

description: After living in New Jersey and New York, I was convinced they had the best sandwiches.  However, this place hangs with the best.  The Dutch crunch roll is amazing and the chipotle chicken is so good to
author: Adam K.

description:
Love these sandwiches. The French roll is amazing always fresh. Quality ingredients and friendly service. 
I love that this place is consistently good - the only thing negative is that their menu is too big! They've got tons of sandwiches to choose from then even more specials written on several different areas so it's overwhelming. I'm not even sure I've had the best ones yet!
author: Piper W.

description: Really nice husband and wife team, the best homemade bread and amazing service. They even re made my sandwich for free when I didn't like an ingredient. Very high quality!!
author: Laurence S.

description: I'm not sure why this place isn't packed at lunchtime. Had the chipotle chicken sandwich and came with a Caesar. They bake their own bread and was really good.
author: J P.

description:
I always wondered about Good Eats Cafe, it's next door from Chez Fayala, and has a solid 4 star review on Yelp. But Fayala always has a line and has delicious smells wafting from its doors, and after a year of being in the neighborhood I have yet to visit.

Today I resolved to get a sandwich at Good Eats, despite very mediocre reviews from my fellow Yelp friends. The sandwich was traditional but tasty, decently priced, smaller than Miss Tomato/Cafe Algiers, and felt lighter. I'd recommend to those who are looking for more unique combinations (they have wasabi chicken flavor!), and prefer a less carb-heavy sandwich (their fresh bread is light and fluffy).

* PASTRAMI ROYALE SANDWICH ($8.70) - 4 STARS: 
Pastrami, sauteed mushrooms, carmalized onion, swiss cheese, lettuce and tomatoes on toasted rye (swapped with the French Roll), add complimentary Caesar Salad. There was a good amount of sliced pastrami, which paired well with the airy bread and bacon - filling and satisfying without weighing you down. They added mayo which overpowered it even though I asked for it "light". Side salad was tiny but a refreshing compliment to the sandwich.

Overall, this is a pretty traditional, small, but satisfying sandwich which stands out because of their homemade fresh-baked bread. I prefer a heavier, carbier sandwich (a la Algiers and Tomato) but would definitely return to mix up the routine. Can't wait to come back and try the breakfast burritos!

Pro-Tip: Credit Cards Accepted!
author: Jess C.

description:
Great little cafe with several choices of fresh sandwiches. 

The bread is freshly made and delicious. Their roasted chicken is very flavorful and moist. I usually go for the Chicken Pesto Basil sandwich, which is loaded with pesto and sun-dried tomatoes. 

Good place to try if you're looking for something other than the regular chains.
author: Kelly E.

description:
There's something lethargic about the operation here. Not that I don't think the owners are hard-working and proud of their business, but there's just something that always feels a little tired the few times I've come to get a sandwich. Maybe it's because Good Eats doesn't attract the lunchtime foot traffic of the battling buffets at Chez Fayala next door or Cafe Med across the street. It's a more modest shop serving just sandwiches, salads and wraps, all of which can be found in any number of shops in this part of the FiDi (photo: http://bit.ly/1ftCNuU). Perhaps the lack of a unique value proposition contributes to my inability to retain a memory of it. I keep forgetting it's there until I glance up from my iPhone strolling up Pine.

I'm usually in a hurry when I come here, not wanting to wait in line at the other more popular spots. I guess it's like asking the wallflower to dance. Funny thing is that I end up getting the same thing every time, the $6.69 Rosemary Cranberry Chicken Salad on Toasted Sourdough (photo: http://bit.ly/172l4sW). It always sounds good to me, and yet when I get back to my desk, I never finish it because they overdo the mayo or underdo the cranberries. Something always feels off about the sandwich. I do like the fact that they offer the option of a Caesar Salad on the side, which of course, I always take. Singularly unmemorable. So why do I come back here? I haven't the foggiest idea. Creature of habit, I suppose. Maybe I need to try a wrap next time.

FOOD - 2 stars...unmemorable sandwich...which I keep ordering again by rote
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...strangely quiet in here during the lunch hour
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...just feels tired in here
TOTAL - 2 stars...they need to serve up something people can get excited about
author: Ed U.

description:
I really like Good Eats for lunchtime sandwiches. They have a good choice of fillings and bread, and each sandwich comes with a choice of Caesar or Spring salad. The sandwiches aren't too greasy, and (for downtown SF prices) not overly expensive.

There's also never much of a queue, which is nice for a change. But usual SF-sandwich-hunting lunchtime rules apply - go a little earlier/later for best results!
author: Joe B.

description:
I was disgusted. Went there for breakfast, ordered a breakfast sandwich. There seemed to be only one person working that morning (maybe the owner?), and he was working the register and making the food. After handling money and credit cards at the register, he grabbed two slices of bread with his bare hands, and started making my sandwich! Didn't wash his hands, didn't put on gloves. Seriously?

I didn't say anything, but I ended up throwing the sandwich away. Never going back there again.
author: James D.

description: American cheese and that disgusting pre-processed guacamole. Blech.
author: Aaron C.

description: Not a bad spot, but I wasn't exactly blown away. I came here today on my lunch break and ordered a chicken pesto on French bread with a side of Caesar salad. The spot is nice albeit a little crowded, but from the amount of people coming in and out it looked like a lot of people take it to go (as I was). The guy behind the counter was nice nothing too spectacular, but I got my food pretty fast and was on my way. The salad was actually very fresh and quite good. The sandwich was where I was a bit 50/50. It was good, but it wasn't extraordinary. It was a bit spicy which was unexpected to me but I didn't feel like there was much taste to it. Overall, this might have been a fluke, but I would be willing to give this spot another chance and try something else!
author: James R.

description:
Fresh baked bread, quality ingredients and fast service! 

I ordered the chipotle chicken avocado and it was delicious! The sandwiches are served with either a spring or Cesar salad. I had the spring salad which is served with a balsamic dressing. The dressing was flavorful but not over done. 

The menu is abundant but literally the four people in line in front of me ordered the chicken chipotle. 

The bread is soft and delicious. It sets the sandwiches apart from your typical quick service sandwich shop. 

The chicken is thick cut and not over cooked. The avocado was fresh and spread generously.

The cashier took my order quickly and I waited maybe four minutes. The cashier was also friendly and helpful. 

Would definitely recommend for a quick it satisfying lunch.
author: Linda B.

description: I had the Mediterranean veggie sandwich on wheat. So yummy! That and the salad that comes with it was a just-right sized lunch for nine bucks?! Are you kidding?! And lightening fast, friendly service too. I'm going back!
author: Robin T.

description: Excellent sandwiches at reasonable prices! They bake their own bread too! The salads are also good. I have eaten many of the sandwiches here and I have enjoyed them all. I have even catered business meetings through Good Eats and they always do a stellar job. They truly take a lot of care and love in preparing the food.
author: Lucy L.

description:
House made bread is top notch and since they can control quality by making their own bread they won't have all the different types one might be accustomed to from a sandwich joint in the fidi but the ingredients are all very good because you can tell it's fresh. The standard offerings include a side salad which makes this a good option to grab a quick bite and the service to date has always been friendly. 

pros: fresh bread. spring mix or caesar salad included. fits in the under $10 lunch category. 

Downside: portions are decent but not as robust compared to some of the other sandwich places you can find in the area. 
Price/meat ratio could be better.
author: Norris T.

description: I think this is one of the best sandwich places in the city. I don't know why it isn't more popular. Their chipotle chicken avocado sandwich is seriously one of the best sandwiches i've ever had. The turkey club is also great. Everytime their sandwiches come up on my meal pal I order one and I just can't get enough! Do yourself a favor and try out the chipotle chicken sandwich - you will not be disappointed.
author: Ashley B.

description: I've used Good Eats for several lunch meetings and love these guys! Clients enjoyed the food. Ramsey the Owner does a great job.
author: Bob K.

description: This is my go-to lunch spot while at work! All ingredients taste fresh and they make their own bread daily. They offer a side salad with your sandwich so you still get your greens. I use Good Eats for catering meetings as well as my own personal lunch and I'm never disappointed.
author: Alison Y.

description: Please note: This review is based on my first experience at Good Eats. My sandwich was very filling with a good mix of flavors. However, the side salad had very little dressing in it. Is it supposed to be served without dressing? Most of the bites didn't have dressing, so I am confused. Also, I found a small hair in the paper that my sandwich was wrapped in :(
author: Haley M.

description: Great sandwiches and really reasonable prices.  Got the turkey supreme (which is basically a turkey reuben) on pumpernickel and it was awesome.  Whats great about this place is that they bake their bread fresh daily.  I definitely will be coming back here for lunch.
author: Yasi N.

description: Remember I said I would come back to let them redeem themselves and that they did. I got the chicken pesto w/ avocado on pumpernickel. Hands down screaming!!!! Sooooooo good. And to make things better my sandwich was on the house!!!!!!! I'm very happy!!!!
author: Devone W.

description: This place is awesome. For less than $10, you get a delicious sandwich and a side salad. The bread is baked there. The staff is super friendly. It usually isn't too crowded and there are tables to eat. Anytime I'm looking to meet someone in the FiDi or want a quick lunch, this is my spot. Keep up the great work!
author: Connor S.

description:
I only had about 20 minutes for lunch and this place didn't have a line out the door (either my lucky day or a premonition).  After a brief glance at the menu I decided that I was in the mood for their Falafel Wrap.  

The Verdict:

A decent wrap.  The falafel themselves were crisp on the outside and moist in the middle.  The vegetables in the wrap were fresh.  The only real disappointment was the white sauce - terribly bland.  If they could have nailed that I would have been tempted to give a fourth star.

Will I rush back?  Probably not.  But if I'm in the area again and need a quick lunch it will definitely be an option.
author: Andreas H.

description:
Good Eats sells a varitey of sammies, wraps, burritos, and expresso. 
not much sitdown room, mostly to go.

pour: only 1 blend coffee(cafe U...)1.90
-bland, lacked body, slightly acidic.

drips:
-Good Eats maybe, not good drinks....
author: Victor G.

description:
My favorite place to grab a strong cup of joe and sandwiches with fresh-baked bread.  I occasionally grab a breakfast burrito, which is only $5 bucks but is a lot of food. 

As for the basics, this place has a food health and safety score of 100!!!  Enough said, this place is sparkling, squeaky clean!  I have to say, i do appreciate the cleanliness. I think we all seem to forget about this when we don't actually see the kitchen or see how our food is prepared.  So A++ for the score.  

The owner is super nice and great customer service everytime! 

As for lunch, I don't think I can find a place that beats their freshly-baked French bread on their sandwiches.  The bread is simply awesome!  My personal favorite is their wasabi trio, which comes with their special wasabi sauce.  The sandwich is of substantial size, which comes with a side salad, all for $9 bucks.  An unbeatable deal for lunching in financial district.  

It's a small place and usually small line during lunch time. All in all, great place to grab a great sandwich or breakfast for your money.
author: Lilian T.

description: I love Good Eats! I've only had their sandwiches so I don't know about their other food, but the sandwiches are fresh and so delicious! They have a variety of bread to choose from, as well as so many different sandwiches. The side salad is perfect - fresh and not soggy with dressing. Their service is terrific, and they always graciously accommodate my requests for adding/subtracting vegetables from my sandwiches. I go here often!
author: Mick J.

description: Although my sandwich is good, the service was gruff and my salad looks anything BUT healthy. Don't use the word healthy in your cafe name if you can't consistently deliver.
author: a l.

description:
Breakfast burritos are BOMB. The end. 

PS, 4 stars b/c last time I got a BLAT that was way too mayo-generous.
author: Adele A.

description:
BEST BREAKFAST BURRITO IN THE FINANCIAL DISTRICT. I have a BB addiction and have eaten at places all around the Financial district.. This place takes the cake. Also, it's super reasonably priced and the owner is friendly/appreciative. 

The secret is to get the chipotle BB and add avocado. Also the sandwiches are bomb!
author: James C.

description:
I work pretty close to here and usually go 3-4 times a month for a sausage breakfast burrito if I'm hungry, they're pretty good and relatively cheap for the area.

Tip: Don't use pennies to pay (they round everything down)
author: Adam J.

description:
I must apologize to the owner for not writing this sooner! It was on my second or third visit that I told him I wanted to sing his praises all over Yelp.

I think the first thing I tried was the Greek Wrap (Med wrap? I forget its name) - the wrap itself thin, not so thin as to fall apart, but also not so thick you feel like you're filling up on dough. There's a great balance of delicious contents, the kalamata olives are a-plenty  and the homemade hummus is creamy and flavorful. This is my go-to lunch pick, only when I'm super hungry though, considering it's size is close to that of a large burrito. 

There sandwiches are also pretty spectacular, I've tried quite a few and they're all stuffed to capacity with meats and amazing homemade sauces (I think everything is homemade, I know the bread absolutely is!). Anytime I get a sandwich for lunch I end up with half of it leftover for the next day, this is likely because I eat super slowly and because it comes with a side salad as well. 

Breakfast? Breakfast here is so tasty I had to stop going in as much as I was. Their sesame seed bagels and blueberry muffins are so moist and flavorful I would eat one every single day if my metabolism was much faster and more respectful of all the bread-y goodness I'd like to indulge in. The breakfast burritos are magical, let me tell you. The eggs are fluffy, the cheese is cheesy, and that sauce explodes deliciousness in your moth - WARNING - may also explode on your keyboard, use caution and many napkins.

The owner is friendly and always remembers how I like my coffee. Please visit this place, considering the neighborhood prices are low and quality is high. I can get a bagel and cream cheese with coffee for about 4 bucks - you know that's unusual for the area! Eat here, the eats ARE good.
author: Chris P.

description:
Good Eats is a fantastic sandwich shop that always does me proud.  I've eaten there half a dozen times and tried a different sandwich every time (with the exception of pumpernickel bread, I can't defy it!) seeing if there is a hole in their game.  There isn't.  I might as well call Good Eats "church" because I always leave fed.  Amen!  

The service is always nice no matter who is taking care of you.  The prices are cheap especially considering the volume you're returned.  Your sandwich never takes more than a matter of minutes.  The produce is always cool, fresh, and crisp; a wonderful contrast to the warm, soft, just baked bread.  From pastrami and swiss to chipotle chicken, these sandwiches are hefty for your money and hearty to your appetite.  The little side salad is a nice touch.  It makes you feel like you didn't pay solely for a sandwich.  On nearly every occasion I have ended up saving the other half of my sandwich for the following day.  And the following day it is still delicious.  I cannot encourage my fellow Yelpers enough to make a run to this spot.  You will leave satisfied.
author: Nick J.

description: Great sandwiches. Mediterranean veggie excellent! Pastrami on dutch crunch roll excellent. Side salad a little too vinegary for me but side caeser great. Pleasant employees, self bussing, great location.
author: Barbara B.

description:
"Meh" describes this place quite accurately. Really.. don't waste your time here unless you like plain and dry sandwiches.

I tried the touted Chicken Pesto sandwich on their home made bread. The chicken was dry and the pesto didn't really do much to help with that. There wasn't much flavor and it wasn't really all that warm either. I can't say anything really good about my food, it was extremely BLAND!

Their outdoor seating includes 2 small round tables and it smelled like pee on the street so it wasn't all that appetizing to eat outside.

BUT, their home made chocolate chip cookies are heavenly! And, the wait was nonexistent in the middle of lunchtime. 2 stars for that I guess..
author: Kathy S.

description:
Man, what a let down the Chicken Pesto sandwich is. Unfortunately that's all I've had to eat there. To be fair, I do not like sun dried tomatoes, which I didn't expect to be on the sandwich when I ordered.

I've had better chicken pesto in the burbs. 

The bread was the best part, but honestly I'd rather have a sandwich from Good Luck Cafe than Good Eats Cafe.
author: Gina B.

description:
I'm in town for a meeting. My friend and I are looking for non-hotel food. Good Eats Cafe seems to have some good reviews. We stop in and the place is relatively quiet. Two guys behind the counter are friendly. I ordered a breakfast sandwich [eggs, bacon, cheese, potato bagel] and my friend ordered a breakfast burrito [eggs, potato, cheese]. They were both pretty good. The coffee was 'fresh-ish' and if we were in the mood, there were a number of bottled juices available. 

The food is really good. The place has a few tables, but it's not designed to be a sit down restaurant. It's great if you work in the area and are looking for good food. But IMHO it's not really a destination. [I wish I had a place like this by my office.]
author: Dave C.

description: One of my favorite sandwich spot near work. I especially love their chicken pesto sandwich. There's something special about the way they season the chicken breast meat that makes it so flavorful. Combine that with the fresh bread they bake daily, it makes for a delicious sandwich! Each order of sandwich also comes with a choice of mixed green or Cesar salad.
author: Lisa Q.

description:
Good value, but average food. Ordered the Mediterranean Veggie and was surprised it came with a side Caesar salad. Again great value for the Financial District, but food was a little too saucy and heavy in my personal opinion.  

They have spots to eat inside and out which is nice, and the staff was pretty friendly as well. All-in-all an ok place to stop, but won't make it a regular place to go.
author: Carissa W.

description:
Update:  They just discontinued the mini bella!  I've been there a bunch now and I think that was the best.

Readers, please go in and ask them to bring it back.
author: G M.

description: Really good sandwich shop.  The fresh baked french roll on the chicken sandwiches tops it off!
author: Raj G.

description:
This is seriously the best bread I have ever tasted, and it is seriously the best sandwich in San Francisco. 

I'm dangerously addicted to the chicken chipotle. The fact that the owner and his staff are so nice and friendly, the prices reasonable, and the food healthy is just an added bonus.
author: Brandon S.

description: I love this place! It helps that I work in the building right next door, but the prices also make it a great place to frequent. For $9, you can get an actual meal (a whole sandwich with a salad) unlike a lot of places in the overpriced FiDi. They are pretty quick too, even when busy. Not a huge space to sit, but I've always gotten my food to go. I love this place and their fresh baked rolls!
author: Chardae J.

description:
A few co-workers and I typically go to Good Eats 3 to 4 times a week for breakfast and/or lunch. 

Bacon and sausage breakfast burrito is my go to in the morning. The salsa is amazing which I order on the side. 

For lunch I usually get the BLT Apple Wood Sandwich. The bacon that is put on this sandwich is some of the best I've ever had. You also get a side salad with any sandwich order.

Prices are good especially considering the quality or the food. 

I would recommend this to anyone within the financial district.
author: Jason M.

description:
1.  This is a review of take-out lunch.

2.   The counter attendant was very friendly and helpful.  My order was taking quickly.  But, even though, it was right at noon, the restaurant was pretty empty. 

3.  My food was prepared quickly and very neatly packed into a plastic container.

4.  Italiano - This is very similar to a chicken parmesan sandwich.  The bread was a nice roll.  The tomato sauce was tart but maybe a little too sweet.  The sandwich was well heated.  The chicken was tender.   All of the ingredients were fresh.  It was a good sandwich but I did think the tomato sauce overpowered the flavor profile a little.

http://tinyurl.com/3bhp967


5.  Caesar Salad (included with sandwich)  - This was very simple.  Romaine lettuce, cheese, and dressing.  It was very fresh though.  And I did enjoy it,

6.  Ambiance - It is basic and clean.  For me, this is a takeout spot.  But, if you needed to eat there, it wouldn't be a big thing.  It would do the trick for a basic lunch.  It will not impress an out of town business associate though.

7.  Overall - There are a lot of great sandwich shops in the Fi-Di.  But I thought that with quality, service, and price that Good Eats help up pretty well.
author: Mark D.

description: Best Sandwiches in town.  My boss took me here last year and I have been coming back every week.  The Wasabi Trio (Pastrami, Turkey and Bacon) is my favorite, but everything is great.  They make their bread in house daily.
author: Thomas G.

description:
I'm surprised that they only have 15 reviews.  They may be a little underrated, perhaps overshadowed by Chez Carla next door.  Honestly, I ended up here only because CC was closed.  In a way, I'm glad I did.

It was a very satisfying lunch.  They have a nice, clean space.  The owner is friendly and seems to show great pride in his work.  I tried the pastrami sandwich today.  Good value at around $6.25 and also big and meaty.  The taste was fine, though a little on the dry and salty side.  He may have had a heavy hand on the mustard.  Nonetheless, it's a convenient spot with a nice owner, and extensive selection of good value sandwiches and salads.
author: Angel S.

description: Decent sandwich, kinda pricey, and overall just average.
author: Juan A.

description: Their bacon is a-ma-zing. California BLT all the way when you're there.
author: Joffrey F.

description:
Really friendly service.

I ordered a Falafel wrap, was asked if I liked it spicy. I said just a little bit.

Out comes the biggest wrap ever served to me. The owner gave me a knowing look. So the time I stood up, he already had a paper bag waiting for me.

I put the wrap in the fridge hoping it would still be nice to eat the next day but not expecting it to be, heated it in the toaster oven at work.. I was already thinking about a contingency lunch but Bam! Still yummy!

I thought it was expensive but now I divided that cost into 2.

Will be back to try on their other sandwiches.
author: Paulyne R.

description:
This is probably 4.5 stars, but I think this place should have a higher rating, so I'm going to try and help them out. 

In brief, outstanding sandwiches and I'm a sandwich snob. The free side salad is a nice touch. Very reasonably priced for the in-house bread and good quality ingredients. Folks are really nice too. Breakfast items are also top-notch. 

Give them a try.
author: Jay N.

description:
I've been coming here off and on since they opened.  Today I ordered a chicken portobello mushroom sandwich.   The owner recommended getting their homebaked rolls as the bread for my sandwich.  That roll is huge.  It looks like a smaller version of  the sourdough bowl from Boudin's.  The bread is pretty good - much better than the other option of sliced wheat bread.

The sandwich is filled with chicken, mushroom, tomatoes and lettuce.  A very satisfying lunch indeed.
author: Wendy H.

description:
The service here is FANTASTIC. Always fast and friendly. They know my name! Do you know how rare that is in such a busy location?

I always look forward to getting my lunch here and my boss's lunch too. The ingredients are fresh and the bread is really amazing--they bake it fresh every day. 

My favorite sandwich is the Turkey Royale, and my bosses swear by the Chicken Mediterranean Sandwich. The serving sizes are very generous and I usually make two meals out of my sandwich. 

Best lunch place in the financial district! If you see a line don't fret--they move fast and it will be well worth the wait.
author: Brighton E.

description:
Stopped here with my husband ion our arrival to the city while waiting for our hotel room to be ready, we picked the first thing on the menu that we saw because it looked awesome (a pastrami melt with bacon and avocado) and we were not disappointed. The sandwich was large enough for both of us to share and was awesomely decadent. The avocado was perfectly ripe and yummy too. 

The restaurant is pretty small so it would be difficult to accommodate a large group but is perfect for picking something up to go.  The staff was friendly and efficient. I would eat here again.
author: Amy A.

description:
I give this place 5 stars off the bat because they make their own bread y it's fantastic! The pumpernickel is my favorite but all of them are great.

As far as sandwiches go it really depends on what you fancy but know that their chicken is always moist y that their hot sandwiches will warm your belly. I love the red bell pepper chicken pesto sandwich though :)

In addition the staff is friendly, the service is quick, y the location is convenient for anyone who works in the financial district.
author: Maya-Luisa G.

description: We all enjoyed the breakfast burrito (me sausage... The rest bacon). It was delish!!! Only complaint was that only one person was working... (Later we found out that his employee left him hanging...) reasonably priced and yummy!!!!!
author: Ashley B.

description: 3.5 Stars. Small place with quick service. They have alot of variety, especially with chicken. Get your sammy on a french roll. The bread is really good. Also the sandwhich comes with a small salad. The bbq chicken sandwhich was good, but way too much sauce. Fairly cheap for what you get.
author: Karen H.

description:
(See pic that's not very descriptive hahaha)

I can't quite remember what the space used to be.

I was having a late lunch, had a later meeting and needed something quick so came here and got a falafel. The falafel was gigantic! I could barely sink my teeth in without food trying to get onto my face. The inside was good but the bread was really dry. The guy specifically told me he warmed up the bread, assuming I did not see the slow rolling oven. He was very nice though.

It's a good place if you are extremely hungry but I would suggest plenty of water or soup so you don't choke yourself.
author: T L.

description: I needed a quick bite since I was in a hurry and went in here.  This is a tiny deli that serves sandwiches. It was not busy during lunch hour which is normally a flag. Anyways, the gyro I got was not too bad. I wish they had more dessert options other than biscotti.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Since I've been working in the Financial district, this place has been my go-to for lunch. I usually get the Turkey Royal with spring salad and it's always on-point. I know people say the Chicken Pesto is really good, but.. dat turkey royal...

This place is less than a block away from me, so it's easy to get to. Also, I usually take it back to the office, so the quick service is a definite plus. The place is on the smaller side, but they do have a couple outdoor tables. But hey, if it's a nice warm day in the city, I'd rather find a place where I can sit and enjoy the sun.

Overall, because of the consistency and nearness of the place, I'll give it 5 stars.
author: Winston B.

description:
1.  The Chicken Pesto sandwich is off the chain.  If you only go there 1 time in your life, get it
2.  You get a good amount of food at a very reasonable price (especially in the Financial District)
3.  The people who run it (I think its the family who owns the business) are very friendly; one of the reasons I frequent their spot so often
4.  Once you have had the Chicken Pesto 5 or 6 times move on to the Hot Pastram for a change up
author: Chris N.

description: I was headed to Chez Fayala one day, but the line was too long. So I decided to try this place right next door. I was surprised to find that this place was pretty good! Than food is very tasty. Try the Thai Chicken Wrap :) There can be a bit of a wait sometimes to get the food after you order it, but it's worth the wait. There's often no line (or a very short line). The indoor seating is not that good, but there are nice places to eat nearby.
author: Alexander R.

description:
Breakfast sandwich for $3.95 or burrito for $3.99, and for breakfast time, it comes with a free 12 oz. coffee.

Sandwich comes with a choice of starch (bagel, sandwich bread or english muffin); cheese, choice of meat (ham or bacon), and scrambled eggs.   If you get the burrito same inside but also with potatoes and salsa.  

Excellent sandwich!  Friendly service.    (With tax my sammich came out to $4.33 for a delicious breakfast and piping hot coffee)   

They had samples of their scones...delicious and moist.  (I'm used to non-moist scones, but hey it's all good, ;))

My only complaint: they have a big menu...but they should post DESCRIPTIONS of what's inside the sandwich/burritos.... on something other than size 14 font.  

Cash or plastic work here too.

And with this review...I finished the sandwich and realized, I'm going to have a smaller lunch.  :P
author: Fannie S.

description: Best sandwich place ever!! The bread is fresh and amazing. Menu has tons of options and staff is very friendly. Favorite sandwich place in the city!! Go here!!!
author: Becca A.

description:
I'm taking my breakfast borrito one a week there, and I never tast better!
There are warm and the homemade salsa is excellent.
Also I tried the chicken pesto and the chicken Mediterranean and I loved both ,with the salad on the side its the perfect lunch! The high quality of the food and the fresh baked rolls make the differents with the other place in the financial district !
 I don't have many time to go take lunch there but I will try other sandwich next time for sure!
author: Lucie C.

description: I am in love with their turkey royal sandwich! It is a weekly thing for me and I'm always satisfied. I especially love how their sandwiches are always made with care; never sloppy or messy (in my experience). They are pretty quick once you order but can get busy during the normal lunch hour so if you don't like to wait in lines like myself I'd suggest pre-ordering for pick up. Nice people who are wonderful and efficient at what they do.
author: Sierra R.

description:
Came here on my hunt for a quick lunch - ordered the Chicken Pesto Basil sandwich with Caesar salad. I'm a sucker for pesto, and since they had pretty good portions and the sandwich was fresh out of the oven (toaster?), I was pretty satisfied. The bread was the perfect firmness and flouriness, and I loved the melty cheese! The salad was whatever as far as salads go; the leaves were bitter and the dressing was thin.

Overall, I think it's a good place for lunch, especially since it was very reasonably priced. The place was clean and there were maybe 8-ish tables to sit down at, but everyone who grabs lunch in the area gets it to go anyway. Quick and friendly service, and just very convenient and hassle-free if you work in the FiDi.
author: Katie M.

description: This place is quite disappointing given the reviews, at least as a breakfast option.  The choice is very limited and what happens is you get your sandwich toasted on the regular Orowheat bread, with not much taste and variety in it. Service was also mediocre. Will not come back.
author: Piotr G.

description: Best sandwiches in FiDi!  Bread is baked fresh on site every day!  Pastrami is lean and spiced just right.  Turkey is real baked and hand sliced.  Only place I go now for lunch.
author: Mark T.

description:
They seem to be going for a balance between family-run homemade quality and affordability ... doing a pretty good job of it I must say. Nice choice in an area that's otherwise mostly fast food and 8000 Lee's Delis

Breakfast burrito didn't make a good first impression - ice cold salsa and potatoes added after heating everything else? - but after the temp. evened out it grew on me quickly. Good quality, nice size for the ($4.75) price. Worth the small premium over Subway's lame-o breakfast sammiches

Lunch sandwiches look pretty good (haven't tried yet), for my experience gyros are the real winner here though. $5-7 price range is about as good as it gets for a place that has to pay FiDi rent, good portion sizes

Unfortunately have to warn you off from the coffee though ... $1.25 for 12 oz. is a nice price for around here but it's some of the weakest stuff I've had in a while.

Love the faux fireplace in front. What other little grab-and-go places do something like that? Accentuates the "coziness" (i.e. not much seating so be prepared beforehand to take lunch "to go" somewhere)
author: Jeremy H.

description: Chipotle chicken sand with avocado on wheat and a side salad. Good.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
I originally gave this place a slightly higher review, but I was very surprised that the owner of the restaurant sent me a private message ATTACKING my opinions of his restaurant. He claims that I must not be able to "recognize quality." 

I originally thought of it as another average deli in FiDi with a decent selection of okay but not spectacular sandwiches. However, now I am insulted by the attitude with which the owner treats his customers. 

To me, a good restaurant would take heed of constructive criticism from consumers and try to improve his restaurant rather than dismiss them. 

Instead of reading my review and trying to use it constructively (and it wasn't even a bad review), the owner INSULTED me for expressing my opinions and tried to CENSOR how I felt. 

It was my own personal opinion about my own personal experience with the restaurant, and all I said was that it was mediocre.

The customer should be able to voice their opinions freely without being asked to censor them, especially on a public forum like Yelp. 

Definitely never coming here again.
author: Denton X.

description:
Was heading toward Chez Carla (or whatever the name is now) and had walked by this place several times.  Well they put some pictures up in the window and the sandwiches looked great.

Decided to give the Chicken Pesto sandwich a whirl and it was one of the best sandwiches I have had in the FiDi.

Comes on fresh baked french roll and with choice of side salad for a couple of bucks cheaper than the place next door.

Will be coming back again and again.
author: Jared T.

description:
Gave their breakfast burrito a second chance.  

Bacon or ham are your only choices.  The potatoes inside are kind of flavorless, salsa is a tad bland--for salsa--but the cheese bacon and eggs are well done.  Also, the tortilla is pretty good.

Competent burrito for a fair price.
author: Mike I.

description: Had lunch here today and it was delicious. Service by ramzi was awesome. We will definitely be back!!!
author: emily p.

description: Favorite breakfast burritos in the city, and the fact that they deliver makes it even better.
author: Ashraf A.

description:
I'm always on the hunt for breakfast. To meet my bfast criteria it needs to be two things:

1.) Cheap (under $5)
2.) Filling (I mean eggs, cheese, the works) 

Luckily I was here one afternoon, to actually ask them about the closing of Chez Carla, but I did walk away with a menu.

First things listed on the front of their menu... BREAKFAST IDEAS.. ALL with the price tag of under $5 SCORE =) 

So far I had:

Roasted Red Bell Pepper Wrap: 2 eggs, bacon or ham, avacado, pesto, baby spinach, cheese on tortilla
GOD, I didnt eat until 9 hours later @ dinner, cus this thing kept me full!! But not a food coma, passout full.  Just PERFECT full.  Most important, it was GOOD!

Gyro Bfast Wrap: 2 eggs, lamb gyro meat, potatoes, cheese & salsa on tortilla
 I said I like my bfast FILLING, so this totally fit the bill. Was the perfect amount of fixings. A minor food coma, but that's potato for you. Yummy either way.

Coming back for lunch one of these days, but this place is a total solid when it comes to my breakfast!
author: Deanna T.

description: Amazing spot for lunch or breakfast. Everything is made fresh, and they offer great service. The two ladies at the cash are always so friendly and helpful. My favorite is the chicken chipotle and chicken Mediterranean. Must give this place a try!
author: Ally M.

description: So glad I stopped here! Walking down Pine st. with my boyfriend we were both really tired he just wanted something quick and i managed to talk him out of the subway we saw. Decided to Try Good Eats when i saw that they had coffee. I got a latte =) nice and foamy, not to hot and just what I needed. My boyfriend got the club sandwich and that thing was devoured in n time flat! I got the chicken pesto/basil sandwich. AMAZING! It not only had pesto and basil but also had lettuce sun dried tomatoes and I think the cheese was mozzarella. It was toasty warm and delicious.  The homemade bread was flavorful and I could kill a roll or 3 all by itself! The owner was nice and friendly ( he suggested my sandwich to) but wasn't annoying or bugging us while we ate. The decor was really nice to. I liked the cute quiet cafe. Definitely going to be back and would recommend this business.
author: Chelsey L.

description:
Best Breakfast Burrito in the city! Try the bacon breakfast burrito. Perfect way to kick off your day. They also have fantastic coffee. In my opinion better than both Illy's and Coffee Bar.  

For lunch I recommend the Pastrami Extreme and Chipotle Chicken. They bake their own bread every day, and the sandwich includes either a Caesar or Garden Salad. 
 
Above all, it's a pleasure to come to this place. Friendly and fast service. Highly highly recommended!
author: John S.

description: Good Eats Cafe is just what the name is. Good eats. It is a small business in San Fran but is a great place to stop in for an affordable quick lunch. Like any small business though there a limitations that happen. Because there was a big rush earlier in the day they ran out of Chicken which i was craving... I didn't leave though and decided to go with a hot pastrami sandwich that was pretty bomb! Comes with a side salad but its just some lettuce with balsamic on it, not anything special. The bread though is really good. I mean really good. I want to learn to make that stuff good. If they had the chicken I probably would have given it a 5 though. Give it a shot.
author: Andre J.

description:
I always passed by this place when going to Chez Fayala but I never bothered going in.  That is, until I yelped for some new breakfast ideas. 

I decided to try the Roasted Red Bell Pepper Pesto Breakfast Wrap. Basically it's scrambled eggs, bacon or ham, avocado, spinach, pesto sauce and provolone all wrapped up in a tortilla. 

For $5, this thing is really filling and very very tasty. The sauce is what sells me. It's pretty big and it can literally hold me over until dinner.  It's fast and cheap and you can even order online.  They even deliver. I need to try their sandwiches next.
author: Resa N.

description:
For anyone looking to have a quick bite with the most freshest ingredients, this is the place to go to. They offer a fast service with the most delicious sandwiches all with a friendly smile.

Being a regular customer of Good Eats Cafe always makes me feel like a family members of theirs. They are the most hardworking and amazing people always making sure you get your order on time - especially in the busy Financial District.

One of my top favorites is the Mediterranean Chicken sandwich and a big big plus for their side salads to each sandwich order you make, outdoor seating and a lovely atmosphere :)
author: Artimmis G.

description:
This review is for their healthy breakfast wrap. 

I can't believe that after working in the financial district for 9 months, I finally discovered breakfast here. Their alternative healthy wrap is the bomb and the price won't hurt your pockets. Everything you could imagine (avacados, red pepper, spinach, tomatoes) with your egg whites is wrapped up in this tortilla with pesto sauce. Not to mention  the man behind the counter is super friendly. Delish, I will be coming here again.
author: Sam D.

description: The owner is very friendly. They make their own bread and it's soft and yummy!  The hot sandwiches come with salad, your lunch is fixed under $10.
author: Angel A.

description:
Just finished my lunch from Good Eats and I was happy with the sandwich I got.  I ordered the red pepper and pesto chicken sandwich (heavy on the good peppers light on the pesto).  The bread was great.  I thought that the chicken they used was only so-so.  It was a little dry.

Overall I thought this place was a good value.  $7 for a sandwich and salad.  I'm looking forward to going back and trying something else on the sandwich menu.
author: Brian G.

description:
I have passed GE about 100 times on my way to meetings or to another place for lunch. I feel a loyalty to a small number of my favorites and when asked where I have been a sheepishly say that I have been busy.

After two trips to GE I think I may have found another place to place guilt again. Chicken Salad with rosemary, oh my, my, my. Savory and creamy with slight tartness of cranberry. All flavors in harmonic balance on toasted multi-grain. Also great is the Mediterranean vegi.

Service is super quick. I'm in and out in less than 5 mins. Can't beat that, when time crunches faster than your own chops.
author: Steve S.

description:
Satisfying. 
Their homemade bread is detectable. Crisp on the outside, soft inside and full of flavor. I ordered the turkey cranberry salad sandwich with a side of Caesar for $7. Decent portion and they pack your sandwich real well. I thought the sandwich was pretty healthy and the side salad isn't much but I didn't expect much from a side salad. The workers were fast and the place was small but it still held a fair amount of people. 

I would come here again to try their pastrami salad..
author: Jennifer D.

description: I got to try their Hot Mediterranian Sandwhich in a Wheat Roll. It has the good combination of  white zucchini, red bell pepper, roasted eggplant, provolone cheese, spring mix and tomatoes, it also comes with a salad which is another plus for me. Their Roll was fantastic!! Once you take a bite out of it,you won't stop until you finish the whole thing. I have no complaints about this place.. Love the sandwhich I ordered and will definitely come back here.
author: Miss Monette R.

description:
Good Eats Cafe is one of those fantastic neighborhood gems.  The Owner has really thought about presenting a range of fresh, healthy, delicious sandwich options and it shows in the taste.  I have never been disappointed with the sandwiches or the service here.

My go-to order is the Hot Mediterranean, which tastes great especially on a chilly day.  The grilled veggies are packed to the brim and the sauce on the sandwich keeps everything flavorful and moist.

One thing I really love about Good Eats is that they bake their own break fresh daily.  I don't mean Subway's generic rolls...These are delicious rolls in a range of styles, such as pumpernickel, whole wheat, French, etc. To me, getting a freshly made sandwich on bread baked in house makes for a very satisfying lunch.

Great service, delicious food and great value. Enjoy!
author: E W.

description:
All I can say is the California BLT I had today at this place was absolutely one of the better sandwiches in the FiDi.  

Definitely try the California BLT on the Whole Wheat Roll at this place.
author: J B.

description:
Back for breakfast. Only this time instead of raving about grilled sandwiches with house sauces, I'm going rave about their healhy breakfast burrito. Five bucks gets you oil free egg whites (no negotiating needed), spinach, red peppers. They used to have wheat tortillas, but no one ordered them. I'm blaming the lack of that option on you all. Don't worry, still love you yelpers.

Wasn't too big, which is a good thing. Didn't feel like I overdid the most important meal of the day.

Americano was outstanding. Must have been the espresso. Or a perfect amount of sugar free vanilla syrup. Or both.

And in case you are wondering, the owner is still beaming.
author: Jason B.

description: The rolls are freshly baked every day and very tasty.  But we were disappointed with the overall sandwich. They weren't bad but we weren't blown away either. My husband had the chicken pesto sandwich and I had a cheese and veggie sammy.
author: Betsy R.

description:
Good Eats Cafe is right next to Chez Carla on Pine St. and has various sandwich and salad options that are reasonably priced for FiDi. They offer falafel and gyro wraps as well. The workers were attentive and friendly when we walked in and were patient with me when I couldn't decide on what I wanted...story of my life. =P

I ordered the hot Mediterranean sandwich ($6.29) and there was a choice of getting a wheat or French roll. Using a fluffy roll for the sandwich instead of 2 slices of bread definitely added to the "wow" factor when it was unwrapped. It was great that the contents of the sandwich were indeed hot and the cheese was melted!

The portion was pretty intimidating for a sandwich but mostly because the roll was thick. It also contained tomato, lettuce, roasted eggplant, zucchini, red bell peppers, provolone cheese, and a generous amount of basil pesto spread. I didn't expect it to be spicy but the veggies were seasoned with various spices and packed a significant amount of heat. It was very appetizing, flavorful, and filling!

Will be back soon...on my rotation of lunch places!
author: Karen Y.

description: On a gloomy day, I was really craving something warm and fresh. This little spot is right across the street from where I work and I had passed it many times before so I thought I'd give it a try. Upon entering, the place seemed pretty clean and there was a short line. All good signs. I ordered the breakfast burrito with bacon. It took about 2 minutes to make, and I heard the microwave (probably for the eggs). After paying 5 bucks, headed back to the office and opened up this much anticipated breakfast burrito. It was flat! It caught me by surprise - I was expecting a round, plump breakfast burrito. It had been put into a panini press. Thus - it's NOT your traditional breakfast burrito. It consisted of sliced potato, egg, bacon, and some salsa. Not too bad, but I'm not sure I'd go nuts over it. It can probably cure a hangover but I've had better. I may come back just to try the regular sandwiches for lunch.
author: Samantha N.

description: The chipotle cranberry chicken sandwich is to die for!
author: Lauren D.

description:
I passed by Good Eats so many times on my way to the optometrist or have stopped right in front of it to eat at Chez Carla.  I decided one day "Why the heck not?" and tried this place out for size.  I got a Pesto Chicken sandwich, and boy oh boy, was it surprisingly delicious.  Surprising because it came on a French roll shaped like a hamburger bun (must have taken some inspiration from Vivi's Cafe in Cupertino).  

I will definitely go to this place again now that I discovered it, but the hard part is going to this place the first time.  Although it is on a major street, it is not appetizing on the exterior for some odd reason, as I would still rather go to Chez Carla just from walking by it.  For some reason, you have to force yourself to go inside (just as you probably force yourself to go to the gym sometimes), but afterward, just like in a workout, you leave feeling satisfied.
author: Min P.

description: This place has solid deli meat sandwiches and good coffee.  There is always searing and the service great.  It is also conveniently located in the financial district so definitely recommend going here for a great lunch.
author: Samantha S.

description: I ordered the Chicken Pesto Basil Pannini on wheat roll and am I amazed or what. It is one of the best pannini I have eaten. Not only is the food quick, it is cheap(ish) and service was quick (maybe because I was the only one there).
author: Subba K.

description: Came here to grab a bagel and it's quaint and cute.  Wish there was a little more space to hang out, but it's pretty quick in and out type of place.
author: Mel G.

description: I work nearby and I come here around a couple times a week. The sandwiches here are tasty and the bread is always fresh, plus you get a little salad on the side. The BLT is fantastic as far as I'm concerned. I also love the bacon breakfast burrito. The owners are nice and the prices are reasonable. I'll keep coming back as long as they (and I) are around.
author: J N.

description: Top notch family owned establishment. Best breakfast burrito I've ever had (no lie). They make everything from scratch daily and have great service.
author: Charles F.

description:
Sleeping in and being late to work means standing in a horrendous line at Starbucks or Peets for a frickin' medium half-caf.  Nope, won't do it.
Good Eats Cafe, a tiny place on Pine Street, I counted on it not being crowded, and so, fast.  Yes, not crowded.  I was the only one there.  Fast, no.  It got to the point where I was wondering what the poor man was doing. 
And no non-fat to add!
The lunch menu looks interesting with deli sandwiches and salads offered at 5-7 bucks.
author: Meg W.

description: After reading these Yelp reviews, I went in here for breakfast a couple of days ago. The woman at the counter seemed like she was having a bad day; I was greeted with no smiles or pleasantries, and felt like I was putting her out and testing her patience by even coming in. I ordered the Roasted Red Bell Pepper + Pesto breakfast burrito with bacon, and got one with ham, instead (but I didn't know this until I got back to my desk). I tried to make eye contact, particularly at the end, and got absolutely nothing but coldness. Not a good way to treat customers. The breakfast burrito itself was good, but not great. Based on the food, I might have come back. Based on the service, I definitely won't.
author: Memory E.

description: The best falafel I've had in the city so far!  Flaky wrap, tasty and fresh ingredients with just the right amount of tahini.  Yum!
author: Matt N.

description: Great option for a late lunch. Friendly service.
author: Vicki L.

description: Solid lunch spot with good sandwiches. The home made bread was very good as was the overall quality.
author: Vincent V.

description:
They have been open for less than a week, so I will cut them some slack. There seemed to be a bit of confusion of where to order. Hot tip, if you are not going to have signs up yet, you need to direct people where to go so they don't feel like confused sheep. 

I had the chimichurri chicken sandwich and it was just ok. The bread was soft and the chimichurri sauce was delicious. However, the chicken it self was tremendusly bland. 

I saw someones hot pastrami and it looked good. Maybe I will give that a shot.
author: Jeff P.

description:
I really wanted this place to be good. It was not. A couple coworkers order the Reubens and they weren't very happy. Portion size was small and the temperature was luke warm. 

I decided that I would give them a n honest chance and tried the breakfast burrito. Prices were cheap. Portion size was great. Temperature cold. Burrito was gross. The guy running the place is a nice guy.  

I'm assuming go here for coffee and croissant in the morning.
author: Peter N.

description:
No pretense, no drama, just calm and quick service and a tasty sandwich.  My cranberry/chicken salad sandwich was flavored with just a hint of rosemary and the multi-grain bread was lightly toasted!  Served in a reusable laminated wood tray with salad on the side.
Owner Ramzy is welcoming without overwhelming.  A good, good place to stop and refresh.
author: Mark S.

description:
I always pass this place and never really pay attention to it until one day...

...this aroma just hit me and I had to inside. I looked where the smell is coming from and it's from the hot, steaming pastrami sandwiches.

So I ordered one and it was ecstasy nom-nom-nom! Every bite was juicy and hit and the pastrami was so soft and the juices soaked into the bread added volume to the flavor and complemented the sandwich as a whole.

The staff was nice but I am basing this review on the pastrami sandwich. Will try another sandwich in the future, but the pastrami was what attracted me to this spot.
author: Aaron P.

description: Good Eats Cafe is sandwiched between Chez Carla and Subway on Pine Street. It is a good lunch option if Chez Carla next door has a huge line and you want something better than a Subway sandwich. Good Eats has pretty decent sandwiches. I got the special Sante Fe Chicken Sandwich for $5.99. It was pretty good...grilled chicken, melted cheese and veggies on a toasted roll with your standard mayo and dijon mustard. They offer the normal variety of sandwiches including turkey, pastrami, tuna melt, etc. The free sample pastries (brownies and scones) at the counter tempt you when you order and were actually pretty good.  I recommend Good Eats if you want to grab a quick to-go lunch to eat at the office.
author: Debbie C.

description:
I've been meaning to try this place since it's opened and finally had the opporunity one late afternoon with my coworker. 

- 1 star for really dry bread
- 1 star for serving warm tap water

PALATE 411.
I ordered the Albacore Tuna Sandwhich listed under Gourmet Sandwhich list. My sandwhich was HUGE, i should have took a picture of it. I never knew they made that large of a loaf of bread. I was pretty impressed with the portion and only paying $5.99 for my sandwhich. The sandwhich looked declicious, fresh veggies, not shady on the tuna, and additional pickles. My first bite was not as impressed. The bread was very dry, no maionaise in my sandwhich, there was nothing special about the albacore tune. i felt that i could have bought a can of tuna at Safeway and it would have been tastier. As my mouth was parched from the very dry sandwhich bread i asked for a cup of water. They served me warm water in a cup. WARM WATER? I asked for ice and they did not have any ice because they were near closing hour. But warm water? I just took it and lived with it, i actually needed it because the bread was dry. WORD OF ADVICE, ask for maionaise if you order a sandwhich.

WILL I BE BACK?
I will. My friend enjoyed their soup. I plan to go back and try their soups because their portions in everything were HUGE so you definately get your money's worth. Maybe i'll try a warm sandwhich and ask them to slap some maionaise on my bread.

- service, very kind people
- price, AFFORDABLE
- protions, huge
- ambiance, simple cafe


Until the next review....
author: Jane A.

description:
I've been to Chez Carla next door a few times and never noticed this place until today. I ordered their hot pastrami and swiss sandwich and was really impressed.  I got it with sliced sourdough, which they toasted... and stuffed loads of pastrami in it. Very satisfying.  =)

Another reviewer commented on the inefficiency of their ordering process. Not sure if management did happen to see the comments, but I had no problem with the ordering - I ordered and paid for my food and sat down, and someone brought my order to me.  =)
author: Celia L.

description:
I've been eating here periodically since they opened and really like the fact they make good food with quality ingredients and even bake their own rolls on site.  The food is consistently good, the owner is on site daily making the food, and he truly seems passionate about what he does.  

My only complaint is that ordering and getting your food can be a bit of a cluster f**ck.  I hope management reads this review because the confusion can be eliminated simply by doing this- Customers stand in line at the register, order their food, pay for their food, and then stand off to the side to wait until it's done.  Simple right?  Well, currently people stand in line at the register to make their order, wait for the food, and then need to get back in line at the register to pay for it.  Meanwhile your food is getting cold and you're frustrated that you're standing in line a 2nd time.  Just take the $$$ at the time the order is placed- Problem solved.
author: Spidermonkey J.

description:
Just opened today. Like it's name suggests, they do offer good eats. Had the Turkey Supreme; could barely shove that thing it my mouth---- it was so huge.  

After the first try, it's much better than the Subway located to the right. And I will have to visit a couple of more times before I can say that it is better than Chez Carla to its' left.
author: RJ A.

description:
i would describe this place as decent.  it's definitely a decent lunch option- the sandwiches are good but not amazing, come with a small salad, and its not expensive. i had some kind of a mediterranean chicken and avocado sandwich- the bread was good, the sandwich was tasty, but it was kind of mayo-y and a little greasy.  the caesar salad on the side was good but overdressed.

good value, decent food...definitely a good lunch option if youre in the area.
author: Lisa C.

description: This place gets a solid 4 stars.  I mean, you can get hot Applewood bacon on your sandwich...not cold stuff that's been sitting in a fridge after being cooked. That alone puts them ahead of the pack. Their soft french rolls are THE BEST. The only reason I left off a star is because of how confusing the place is when it comes to ordering. I gather that the manager wants to make it most convenient for customers by making it a "order wherever you want!" type setting, but it's not working in his favor. All in all -definitely eat here. Great food!
author: Autumn Y.

description:
Searching for a new lunch restaurant in the city, I stumbled upon "Good Eats". The cashier lady was very nice and took the time to go over options. I ordered the Cranberry Chicken Salad to eat in the restaurant. Watching the sandwich maker disturbed me as he scooped out the chicken salad w/ an ice cream scoop and then patted the scoop down flat w/ his ungloved tattooed fingers. I don't even like to touch my own food like that. Anyway, I tried to give the woman constructive criticism, but the other sandwich maker (I'm guessing manager) got defensive saying they both had just washed their hands and the health dept only requires them to wash their hands in preparing sandwiches. I told them I am the customer and my reality was that I did not want to eat a sandwich that had been touched by an ungloved hand. At that point, the (pseudo-manager) instructed the woman to get back to the line, they had other customers to serve.

If you like a "take what you get", "the customer comes last" atmosphere, this is your place. I won't be back.
author: Jim L.

description:
I love this place! 

They have great breakfast sandwiches, and I have really enjoyed the Chicken Club and Hot Pastrami sandwiches that I've had for lunch.

Additionally, the owner and the rest of the staff are SUPER sweet! 

Good Eats Cafe is refreshingly unpretentious (something most of San Francisco could stand to learn a thing or two about). 

It's where I go when I want to walk away satisfied and not feel as if I have been gouged. 

It's a simple and no-frills kinda place where you'll likely spend between $6-$8 on average. However, since I don't drink my calories, (hooray for water!) I imagine that drinks might up the cost ante a bit. 

For the Financial District, this is truly a reasonably priced, consistently tasty little spot. It's nestled between the uninspired Subway and the overly-hyped Chez Fayala. 

Yes, I said it, overly-hyped Chez Fayala.
author: Amberjae F.

description: Great sandwiches. Finding a good go to spot for food esp if on the go in the FiDi is always hard and this place is def one I would recommend!
author: Nick S.

description: They make they're rolls on site! The first time I went there I had a chicken salad with cranberry sandwich. It had the right amount of spice and bite! Plus the roll is delicious! The second time I went there, I had the California BLT, which is a regular BLT with avocado! With that, the bacon is thick cut applewood bacon, who wouldn't love that! Will come here when I want to treat myself to a great lunch!
author: Linda L.

description: In general, Downtown San Francisco is the home of the mediocre, over-priced sandwich. But Good Eats is the notable exception, and thank goodness for that. Not only is the home-made bread fantastic, but the sandwich meat is fresh and excellent as well. And you get a good-sized salad for no additional charge. Bottom line is that you can get a fresh, excellent meal for less than eight bucks at Good Eats. And that is a rarity downtown.
author: Chris D.

description:
Great little sandwich spot; relatively new, next to Chez Carla where Soup Freaks used to be.
Everything I've eaten here is very good, no complaints. The hummus lavash with cucumbers and tomatoes is very fresh (they make their own hummus from scratch, so the owner told me).
