The fresh roasted turkey is on the spot, heaped high with quality turkey breast, thinly sliced.  Also good is the hot chicken pesto. I love supporting the new guy on the block, and this place does not disappoint. There's not a huge menu, but what they do have they do right. For the FiDi, the prices are also quite reasonable. 

Good Eats, indeed!
author: Jen M.

description:
Surprisingly good breakfast burrito -- I got the veggie with only eggs, cheese, potatoes, salsa and hot sauce.

it was everything I want in a breakfast burrito and I'll be back for sure.  I don't know if they changed the deal since Fanny S.'s review, but I was not offered free coffee and the burrito was $3.69.
author: Shirin S.

description: I rarely go out  for sandwiches but I wound up here today and really enjoyed it. Had a really tasty chicken sandwich with avocado and a side salad. It was delicious. The owner (I think he was the owner) was very helpful and pleasant. The whole experience was just right. I'll grab sandwiches there again.
author: Doc H.

description: gotta love the free side salad, and fresh bread!
author: Matt A.

description: I had a veggie sandwich yesterday for lunch. I liked it. Price was reasonable.
author: Ajit P.

description:
I work close by this place, so one day I decided to drag my husband here for breakfast. They have breakfast wraps! Delicious, filling, mouth-watering breakfast wraps. My favorite is the Roasted Red Bell Pepper with Pesto. 

Since breakfast was so good, I decided to come here for lunch a few days later. Their sandwiches are pretty bomb. They also come with a choice of spring or ceasar salad. I've had about 3 different sandiches from them (forgot which ones), but each one was great and filling. 

It's a good place, decent prices, and usually the Baklava is $1 IF you order it with one of the lunch specials. 

The people that work there are also really nice and give great service. 

It's a cute place, with good music, good food, and good service. I wish this place was by my home too.
author: Katia T.

description: Great tasting blueberry scones!  Really a nice, friendly place and honest value.  What a pleasant surprise tucked away in the financial district!
author: Steve O.

description: I work across the street from this small eatery.  It is consistently good and offers a great variety of sandwiches for lunch.  In fact, the sandwiches are amazing -- they bake their own sandwich rolls daily whic makes all the difference.  For breakfast or to satisfy a sweet tooth, the scones are melt in your mouth delicious.  The owner always has a smile on his face and the service is fast.  What more does a person need from a great breakfast/lunch spot?  Our office even had a breakfast meeting catered from this delightful place.
author: James S.

description:
I got lunch here for the first time today, and WOW I wish I had come here sooner! I got a roasted turkey sandwich and it was delicious.

First, they bake their own fresh bread every day. It was very soft and delicious, with a nice crispy crust.

The turkey and toppings (mmm cranberry) were yummy and plentiful.

Third, the price was very reasonable. $6.50 for a good size sandwich. Plenty for lunch. Also only slightly more than Subway, but taste-wise, a much better deal.

I can't wait to go back and try other sandwiches (pesto chicken, maybe the hummus sandwich). They also had some good looking coffee drinks and Mighty Leaf tea. The pastry case by the register proved to be very tempting as well. All in all, a great FiDi lunch spot!
author: Bea G.

description: Went here for lunch (eat-in) on a warm sunny day. I was lured in by the chalkboard special.. chicken salad with rosemary and cranberries or something like that. It was delicious! I had it on their pumpernickel bread (they make it on-site), which added just enough kick combined with the rosemary. All sandwiches come with a side salad, which is a nice touch. I will be back!
author: Stephanie D.

description: Have been meaning to try this place forever, so today dropped in.  Ordered the Lamb Gyro (spicey).   I found the Gyro to be bland and loaded with mayo.   Also it was smaller than I expected.   Sorry but I would not recommend that particular item.  Perhaps other items are better.
author: Matthew B.

description:
meh, I'm glad I went once so I was able to try out another new SF lunch spot, but probably won't go back.

They have a sign "Order Here", "Pay Here"... except you order at either spot, which gets confusing and then people cut you in line! grr. 

I got the chicken pesto sandwich. It was good and had a lot of flavor, but it was a lot of bread and not a lot of substance in the middle.

They do have a few small tables which is nice.
author: Caitlin B.

description: consistently a very good sandwich and the fresh baked bread is some of the best in the city hands down.
author: kevin t.

description: they have a great Chicken pesto sandwich that comes with mix green or cesar side salad. portions are big, unless you are very hungry
author: Isa W.

description: I have passed this cafe on the way to Lees Deli, then one day I decided to drop in and get and sandwich.  I was very impressed, the basil pesto chicken sandwich was very flavorful, you can actually taste the chicken.  You might pay a dollar or two more than a Lees Sandwich, mine was around $6.00, but the quality is worth it. I plan to try a salad next time around.
author: Linda P.
